meanings.definition: In a gigantic manner; very large or huge in size.
meanings.sent1: The elephant moved gigantically through the jungle, shaking the ground with each step.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper stood gigantically above the city skyline, casting a shadow over the streets below.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to eat his sandwich gigantically, getting peanut butter all over his face.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds loomed gigantically in the sky, threatening to unleash a downpour.
meanings.sent5: The mountain rose gigantically in the distance, its snow-covered peak glistening in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To a great extent or degree; enormously.
meanings.sent1: She gigantically improved her test scores after studying hard every day.
meanings.sent2: The company's profits grew gigantically after launching their new product.
meanings.sent3: The cat gigantically stretched out on the windowsill, enjoying the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent4: His appetite increased gigantically after playing soccer for hours.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden bloomed gigantically after the heavy rain showered them with water.
